headline: Crypto Reels From a $200 Billion Crash as Casino Crowd Moves On
summary: Cryptocurrencies beyond Bitcoin have been hit hardest in the market downturn that kicked off early October.  A MarketVector index tracking 50 mid- and micro-cap tokens has fallen nearly 70% this year, hitting its weakest level since early 2020.  The retail tide that once lifted everything from Trump-branded coins to dog-theme tokens is no more.

headline: Kalshi, Robinhood and Crypto com Face Cease & Desist Order in Connecticut
summary: Connecticut has sent notices to Kalshi, Robinhood, and Crypto.com for operating illegal online gambling, particularly sports betting. Connecticut has joined other states claiming a rise in illegal sports betting under the prediction market umbrella, which has led to a setback for Kalshi, Robinhood, and Crypto.com. headline: Kalshi, Robinhood, Crypto.com Hit With Connecticut Stop Order for Gambling Violations
summary: Connecticut’s Department of Consumer Protection on Wednesday ordered Kalshi, Robinhood and Crypto.com to halt what it calls unlicensed online gambling in the state, targeting sports-style “prediction” products that regulators say are really illegal wagers.The agency’s Gaming Division issued cease-and-desist letters to KalshiEX LLC, Robinhood Derivatives LLC and Crypto.com, accusing all ...
